task_text: [Public Health Policy][Comparative-Analysis] Compare the vaccine-allocation frameworks of WHO COVAX and the ACP’s suggested national-priority tiers.

gold_end_state.summary: COVAX is framed as a global pooled procurement and allocation mechanism seeking equitable distribution across countries, while ACP focuses on national priority tiers emphasizing frontline workers and high-risk individuals; the two frameworks are complementary—COVAX addresses inter-country equity, ACP addresses intra-country prioritization.

quiz.question: Which mechanism is primarily focused on global pooled procurement?

arguments.text: Comparison of COVAX and ACP allocation frameworks
